text: Read this post in Spanish Estamos emocionados de celebrar el tercer a√±o de Git Commit, nuestro programa anual dedicado a cerrar la brecha de habilidades tecnol√≥gicas y empoderar a estudiantes de todo el pa√≠s. Este a√±o, tambi√©n nos enorgullece lanzar Git Commit 101, nuestro primer curso gratuito de IA en l√≠nea en espa√±ol, disponible para estudiantes y educadores durante todo el a√±o. ¬øPor qu√© Uruguay? Con una de las tasas m√°s altas de conectividad a internet en Am√©rica Latina (m√°s del 70%), lidera la regi√≥n en transformaci√≥n digital y educaci√≥n. Su compromiso con la innovaci√≥n se refleja en su clasificaci√≥n entre las cinco principales econom√≠as latinoamericanas en el √çndice Global de Innovaci√≥n, destac√°ndose en producci√≥n de conocimiento y desarrollo de capital humano. Programas como Git Commit prosperan en este entorno, aline√°ndose perfectamente con la misi√≥n del pa√≠s de construir una econom√≠a basada en el conocimiento y crear oportunidades para comunidades desfavorecidas. Presentamos Git Commit 101 Este a√±o, en colaboraci√≥n con Microsoft AI for Good, lanzamos Git Commit 101, un curso gratuito de IA en l√≠nea transmitido en vivo desde el AI Co-Innovation Lab de Microsoft en Montevideo, el √∫nico laboratorio de este tipo en el hemisferio sur. El curso introduce a los estudiantes a los fundamentos de la IA, herramientas de GitHub y GitHub Copilot, brind√°ndoles habilidades que pueden aplicar de inmediato. En sus primeras semanas, el curso en l√≠nea ya ha atra√≠do a m√°s de 20,000 espectadores. Nuestro evento presencial de Git Commit se llev√≥ a cabo en Centros Educativos Impulso y la Universidad ORT. Juntos recibimos a 125 estudiantes, muchos de ellos de contextos vulnerables, provenientes de 13 instituciones participantes. Los estudiantes escucharon a oradores inspiradores, incluyendo al Dr. Juan M. Lavista Ferres, Vicepresidente Corporativo y Cient√≠fico Principal de Datos del AI for Good Lab de Microsoft; Alejandro Pazos, Gerente Pa√≠s de Microsoft en Uruguay; Eliane Elbaum, Gerente del AI Co-Innovation Lab de Microsoft; y Mario Rodriguez, Director de Producto de GitHub. ‚ÄúEs muy importante que cada uno de ustedes reciba la mejor educaci√≥n posible, porque es a trav√©s de la educaci√≥n y la tecnolog√≠a que vamos a abrir puertas. Es como, en √∫ltima instancia, llegaremos al cielo,‚Äù comparti√≥ Rodriguez durante la ceremonia de clausura en el Laboratorio Tecnol√≥gico del LATU en Montevideo. El poder de la educaci√≥n y la innovaci√≥n Juntos, no solo estamos ense√±ando a los estudiantes c√≥mo usar la tecnolog√≠a, sino tambi√©n empoder√°ndolos para construir un futuro donde la innovaci√≥n sea inclusiva, accesible y sostenible. Estamos emocionados de ver lo que har√°n los participantes de este a√±o y esperamos con ansias Git Commit 2025. Sigamos alcanzando el cielo, juntos. üöÄ We‚Äôre thrilled to celebrate the third year of Git Commit, our annual program dedicated to bridging the tech skills gap and empowering students across the country. This year, we‚Äôre also proud to launch Git Commit 101, our first free online AI course in Spanish, available to students and educators year-round. Why Uruguay With one of the highest rates of internet connectivity in Latin America (over 70%), Uruguay leads the region in digital transformation and education. Its commitment to fostering innovation is reflected in its top-five ranking in the Global Innovation Index among Latin American economies, excelling in knowledge outputs and human capital development. Programs like Git Commit thrive in this environment, aligning perfectly with the nation‚Äôs mission to build a knowledge-based economy and create opportunities for underserved communities. Introducing Git Commit 101 This year, in partnership with Microsoft AI for Good, we launched Git commit 101, a free online AI course streamed live from Microsoft‚Äôs AI Co-Innovation Lab in Montevideo‚Äîthe only lab of its kind in the Southern Hemisphere. The course introduces students to AI fundamentals, GitHub tools, and GitHub Copilot, equipping them with skills they can apply immediately. The online course has already attracted more than 20,000 viewers in its first few weeks. Our in-person Git Commit event was held at Centros Educativos Impulso and ORT University. Together we hosted 125 students, many from vulnerable backgrounds, from 13 participating institutions. Students heard from inspiring speakers including Dr. Juan M. Lavista Ferres, Corporate Vice President and Chief Data Scientist of the AI for Good Lab at Microsoft, Alejandro Pazos, Microsoft‚Äôs Country Manager in Uruguay, Eliane Elbaum, Manager of the Microsoft AI Co-Innovation Lab, and Mario Rodriguez, GitHub‚Äôs Chief Product Officer. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very important that each of you receive the best education possible, because it‚Äôs through education and technology that we‚Äôre going to open doors. It‚Äôs how we‚Äôll ultimately reach for the sky,‚Äù Rodriguez shared during the closing ceremony at the LATU Technology Laboratory in Montevideo. Closing ceremony at the LATU Uruguayan Laboratory of Technology, where we hosted more than 300 guests. The power of education and innovation Together, we‚Äôre not only teaching students how to use technology, but also empowering them to build a future where innovation is inclusive, accessible, and sustainable. We‚Äôre excited to see what this year‚Äôs participants go on to do, and look forward to Git Commit 2025. Let‚Äôs continue to reach for the sky‚Äîtogether. üöÄ Written by Related posts GitHub‚Äôs top blogs of 2024 Explore GitHub‚Äôs top blogs of 2024, featuring new tools, AI breakthroughs, and tips to level up your developer game. html:
Read this post in Spanish

Estamos emocionados de celebrar el tercer a√±o de Git Commit, nuestro programa anual dedicado a cerrar la brecha de habilidades tecnol√≥gicas y empoderar a estudiantes de todo el pa√≠s. Este a√±o, tambi√©n nos enorgullece lanzar Git Commit 101, nuestro primer curso gratuito de IA en l√≠nea en espa√±ol, disponible para estudiantes y educadores durante todo el a√±o.

¬øPor qu√© Uruguay?

Con una de las tasas m√°s altas de conectividad a internet en Am√©rica Latina (m√°s del 70%), lidera la regi√≥n en transformaci√≥n digital y educaci√≥n. Su compromiso con la innovaci√≥n se refleja en su clasificaci√≥n entre las cinco principales econom√≠as latinoamericanas en el √çndice Global de Innovaci√≥n, destac√°ndose en producci√≥n de conocimiento y desarrollo de capital humano.

Programas como Git Commit prosperan en este entorno, aline√°ndose perfectamente con la misi√≥n del pa√≠s de construir una econom√≠a basada en el conocimiento y crear oportunidades para comunidades desfavorecidas.

Presentamos Git Commit 101

Este a√±o, en colaboraci√≥n con Microsoft AI for Good, lanzamos Git Commit 101, un curso gratuito de IA en l√≠nea transmitido en vivo desde el AI Co-Innovation Lab de Microsoft en Montevideo, el √∫nico laboratorio de este tipo en el hemisferio sur. El curso introduce a los estudiantes a los fundamentos de la IA, herramientas de GitHub y GitHub Copilot, brind√°ndoles habilidades que pueden aplicar de inmediato. En sus primeras semanas, el curso en l√≠nea ya ha atra√≠do a m√°s de 20,000 espectadores.

Nuestro evento presencial de Git Commit se llev√≥ a cabo en Centros Educativos Impulso y la Universidad ORT. Juntos recibimos a 125 estudiantes, muchos de ellos de contextos vulnerables, provenientes de 13 instituciones participantes. Los estudiantes escucharon a oradores inspiradores, incluyendo al Dr. Juan M. Lavista Ferres, Vicepresidente Corporativo y Cient√≠fico Principal de Datos del AI for Good Lab de Microsoft; Alejandro Pazos, Gerente Pa√≠s de Microsoft en Uruguay; Eliane Elbaum, Gerente del AI Co-Innovation Lab de Microsoft; y Mario Rodriguez, Director de Producto de GitHub.

‚ÄúEs muy importante que cada uno de ustedes reciba la mejor educaci√≥n posible, porque es a trav√©s de la educaci√≥n y la tecnolog√≠a que vamos a abrir puertas. Es como, en √∫ltima instancia, llegaremos al cielo,‚Äù comparti√≥ Rodriguez durante la ceremonia de clausura en el Laboratorio Tecnol√≥gico del LATU en Montevideo.

El poder de la educaci√≥n y la innovaci√≥n

Juntos, no solo estamos ense√±ando a los estudiantes c√≥mo usar la tecnolog√≠a, sino tambi√©n empoder√°ndolos para construir un futuro donde la innovaci√≥n sea inclusiva, accesible y sostenible. Estamos emocionados de ver lo que har√°n los participantes de este a√±o y esperamos con ansias Git Commit 2025.

Sigamos alcanzando el cielo, juntos. üöÄ

We‚Äôre thrilled to celebrate the third year of Git Commit, our annual program dedicated to bridging the tech skills gap and empowering students across the country. This year, we‚Äôre also proud to launch Git Commit 101, our first free online AI course in Spanish, available to students and educators year-round.

Why Uruguay

With one of the highest rates of internet connectivity in Latin America (over 70%), Uruguay leads the region in digital transformation and education. Its commitment to fostering innovation is reflected in its top-five ranking in the Global Innovation Index among Latin American economies, excelling in knowledge outputs and human capital development.

Programs like Git Commit thrive in this environment, aligning perfectly with the nation‚Äôs mission to build a knowledge-based economy and create opportunities for underserved communities.

Introducing Git Commit 101

This year, in partnership with Microsoft AI for Good, we launched Git commit 101, a free online AI course streamed live from Microsoft‚Äôs AI Co-Innovation Lab in Montevideo‚Äîthe only lab of its kind in the Southern Hemisphere. The course introduces students to AI fundamentals, GitHub tools, and GitHub Copilot, equipping them with skills they can apply immediately. The online course has already attracted more than 20,000 viewers in its first few weeks.

Our in-person Git Commit event was held at Centros Educativos Impulso and ORT University. Together we hosted 125 students, many from vulnerable backgrounds, from 13 participating institutions. Students heard from inspiring speakers including Dr. Juan M. Lavista Ferres, Corporate Vice President and Chief Data Scientist of the AI for Good Lab at Microsoft, Alejandro Pazos, Microsoft‚Äôs Country Manager in Uruguay, Eliane Elbaum, Manager of the Microsoft AI Co-Innovation Lab, and Mario Rodriguez, GitHub‚Äôs Chief Product Officer.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very important that each of you receive the best education possible, because it‚Äôs through education and technology that we‚Äôre going to open doors. It‚Äôs how we‚Äôll ultimately reach for the sky,‚Äù Rodriguez shared during the closing ceremony at the LATU Technology Laboratory in Montevideo.

The power of education and innovation

Together, we‚Äôre not only teaching students how to use technology, but also empowering them to build a future where innovation is inclusive, accessible, and sustainable. We‚Äôre excited to see what this year‚Äôs participants go on to do, and look forward to Git Commit 2025.

Let‚Äôs continue to reach for the sky‚Äîtogether. üöÄ
